basics.name: Jessica Sacher, PhD
basics.title: PhD
basics.label: Microbiology & Biotechnology PhD · Postdoctoral Research Scientist · Co-founder of Phage Directory
basics.summary: Building systems to translate research into impact, exploring tech x bio, writing about the journey.

work.name: Phage Australia
work.location: Westmead Institute for Medical Research, Sydney, Australia
work.description: Part of the team launching Phage Australia, focusing on producing safe personalized phages for patients.
highlights: Produced 17 phage batches for 14 patients across 5 hospitals, with successful treatments in the STAMP clinical trial.

media.title: Creating systems to safely scale phage therapy, from Phage Directory to Phage Australia
media.platform: ALARM Conference, ICBRAR Conference, Evergreen International Phage Conference
media.summary: Talk on scaling phage therapy systems.

media.title: Phage manufacturing challenges and progress at Phage Australia

work.name: Phage Directory LLC
work.summary: Leading efforts to accelerate access to phages for research and therapy through collaboration, digital platforms, and community building.
highlights: Developed an online database to connect researchers, labs, and organizations.
Coordinated over 50 urgent phage sourcing efforts for compassionate use, with successful patient treatments.
Collaborated internationally to create a universal phage management and data platform.
Founded Capsid & Tail, growing it to a 1400+ subscriber base and managing a series of virtual research seminars.
Published research and reviews on phage sourcing and was invited to speak at several international conferences.

work.name: University of Alberta
work.summary: Engaged in multiple research projects focusing on Campylobacter jejuni and phage interactions, developed teaching materials, and supervised students.
highlights: Investigated growth inhibition by a phage glycan binding protein
Developed a phage receptor binding protein identification assay
Characterized novel Campylobacter phage DNA modifications

thesis.title: Insights into the role of the flagellar glycosylation system in Campylobacter jejuni phage-host interactions

publications.name: Attitudes to phage therapy among Australian infectious diseases physicians
publications.summary: Preprint on attitudes towards phage therapy in Australia.

publications.name: Data to Power Precision Phage Therapy: A Look at the Phage Directory–Phage Australia Partnership
publications.summary: Discussion on the partnership between Phage Directory and Phage Australia for precision phage therapy.

publications.name: inPhocus: “State of Phage” Survey Highlights Widespread Diverse Phage Isolation and Research in 40+ Countries
publications.summary: Survey results highlighting global phage research and isolation efforts.

publications.name: Reduced Infection Efficiency of Phage NCTC 12673 on Non-Motile Campylobacter jejuni Strains Is Related to Oxidative Stress
publications.summary: Study on the infection efficiency of Phage NCTC 12673 and its relation to oxidative stress in Campylobacter jejuni.

publications.name: Phage Biobank: Present Challenges and Future Perspectives
publications.summary: Overview of current challenges and future perspectives for phage biobanks.

publications.name: Binding of phage-encoded FlaGrab to motile Campylobacter jejuni flagella inhibits growth, downregulates energy metabolism, and requires specific flagellar glycans
publications.summary: Study on the interaction between phage-encoded FlaGrab and Campylobacter jejuni flagella, detailing the impact on bacterial growth and energy metabolism.

publications.name: PHAGE Futures Congress Meeting Summary Washington, DC January 29 to 30, 2020
publications.summary: Summary of the PHAGE Futures Congress, highlighting key discussions and insights from the event.

publications.name: Deoxyinosine and 7-deaza-2-deoxyguanosine as carriers of genetic information in the DNA of Campylobacter viruses
publications.summary: Research on unique nucleosides in Campylobacter phage DNA, exploring their roles in genetic information encoding.

publications.name: Cj1388 is a RidA homolog and is required for flagella biosynthesis and/or function in Campylobacter jejuni
publications.summary: Identification and analysis of the Cj1388 gene in Campylobacter jejuni, discussing its necessity for flagella biosynthesis and function.

publications.name: Current state of compassionate phage therapy
publications.summary: Overview of the current landscape and challenges in the application of phage therapy on a compassionate basis.

publications.name: Bacterial AB5 toxins inhibit the growth of gut bacteria by targeting ganglioside-like glycoconjugates
publications.summary: Study on the mechanism of bacterial AB5 toxins and their effect on gut bacteria through targeting specific glycoconjugates.

publications.name: Sourcing Phages for Compassionate Use
publications.summary: Discussion on strategies for sourcing bacteriophages for use in compassionate therapy cases.

publications.name: Transcriptomic Analysis of the Campylobacter jejuni Response to T4-Like Phage NCTC 12673 Infection
publications.summary: Analysis of the transcriptional response of Campylobacter jejuni to infection by T4-like phage NCTC 12673.

publications.name: Complete Genome Sequences of Three Campylobacter jejuni Phage-Propagating Strains
publications.summary: Publication of the complete genome sequences for three strains of Campylobacter jejuni used in phage propagation studies.

publications.name: Complete Genome Sequence of Campylobacter jejuni Strain 12567, a Livestock-Associated Clade Representative
publications.summary: Complete genome sequencing of a Campylobacter jejuni strain associated with livestock, providing insights into its genomic characteristics.

publications.name: Development of an Assay for the Identification of Receptor Binding Proteins from Bacteriophages
publications.summary: Description of a new assay developed to identify bacteriophage proteins that bind to bacterial receptors.

publications.name: A Flagellar Glycan-Specific Protein Encoded by Campylobacter Phages Inhibits Host Cell Growth
publications.summary: Research on a phage-encoded protein targeting Campylobacter flagellar glycans and its effect on bacterial growth inhibition.

publications.name: Exploring the interactions between bacteriophage-encoded glycan binding proteins and carbohydrates
publications.summary: Review on the interactions between bacteriophage proteins and carbohydrates, focusing on glycan binding proteins.

publications.name: A receptor-binding protein of Campylobacter jejuni bacteriophage NCTC 12673 recognizes flagellin glycosylated with acetamidino-modified pseudaminic acid
publications.summary: Identification and characterization of a phage receptor-binding protein that recognizes modified flagellin in Campylobacter jejuni.

publications.name: Phage Therapy Collaboration and Compassionate Use
publications.summary: Book chapter discussing phage therapy collaboration and the compassionate use of phages in therapeutic applications.

awards.title: Canada Governor General’s Gold Medal
awards.summary: Awarded to the doctoral graduate with the highest academic standing university-wide.

awards.title: Alexander Graham Bell Canada Graduate Scholarship — Doctoral (CGS-D3)
awards.summary: A prestigious scholarship awarded for doctoral studies.

awards.title: Alberta Innovates Technology Futures Top-Up Award
NSERC Postgraduate Scholarship — Master’s (PGS-M)
awards.summary: Scholarship for Master’s level research studies.

talks.title: Creating systems to scale phage therapy

talks.title: Phages for patients: Updates and challenges in therapeutic phage production at Phage Australia, Westmead

Creating systems to safely scale phage therapy, from Phage Directory to Phage Australia

writings.title: How our phage therapy system works at Phage Australia
writings.summary: An overview of the process at Phage Australia for scaling up personalized phage therapy, aimed at assisting other centers with the challenges of running a successful phage therapy service.

writings.title: From flask to patient: a beginner's foray into tangential flow filtration
writings.summary: A personal experience with starting to use the AKTA Flux for producing cleaner phages for patient treatment.

writings.title: Capsid & Tail Newsletter/Blog
writings.summary: Overseeing the publication of weekly articles covering phage news, jobs, and research. A total of 245 articles published as of November 2023.

writings.title: Investing in the future of phage therapy
writings.summary: An invited viewpoint on the importance of investment in phage therapy for future antimicrobial resistance management.

writings.title: A Bright Outlook for Bacteriophage Applications
writings.summary: An invited editorial discussing the potential and growing interest in bacteriophage applications across various fields.

writings.title: Phage Directory: An origin story
writings.publisher: A Smaller Flea, International Society for Viruses of Microbes
writings.summary: A narrative on the inception and mission of Phage Directory, aiming to connect researchers and promote phage therapy.

writings.title: Technique: Probe Phage Genomes for Host Binding Proteins
writings.summary: A technical piece on methodologies for identifying phage proteins that bind to host bacteria, highlighted as Editor’s Choice for September 2016.

media.title: The Future of Phage Therapy in Combating Antibiotic Resistance
media.summary: An in-depth discussion on how phage therapy presents a promising alternative to traditional antibiotics and the challenges ahead.

media.title: Harnessing Bacteriophages for Next-Generation Therapeutics
media.summary: Exploring the potential of bacteriophages in developing new therapeutic approaches, focusing on recent advancements and future prospects.

media.title: Breaking Down Barriers in Phage Therapy Adoption
media.summary: A panel discussion on the regulatory, logistical, and scientific hurdles in the widespread adoption of phage therapy.

subskills.description: Application of phages in clinical settings.

subskills.description: Modifying phage genomes for enhanced specificity or efficiency.

projects.description: Application of machine learning methods to identify and categorize radio pulsar signal candidates using Python.

projects.name: Image Captioning Metrics Evaluations
projects.description: Evaluating the applicability and limitations of reference-based metrics for image captioning for blind and low vision technology users.
